title: Closing tab order
author: LIyoai
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Expected Behavior
I logoff from a connection the tab next to it will be activated

## Current Behavior
I logoff and the first tab is activated. If I just close a tab, without logging off the next tab is activated as I would expect it.

## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)
1. Open three connections
2. Logoff from the third

## Your Environment
* Version used: 1.77.1.27713
* Operating System and version (e.g. Windows...

iterations.description: When closing a tab, focus jumps to the next tab by position instead of returning to the previously active tab (MRU order), which breaks multi-session workflows.

notes:
AI triage (claude): When closing a tab, focus jumps to the next tab by position instead of returning to the previously active tab (MRU order), which breaks multi-session workflows.
Approach: Track tab activation history in a stack/MRU list in ConnectionWindow; on tab close, pop the stack and activate the previous tab instead of the positionally adjacent one.
